attributes.action: Local GPs should have more training in dealing with transgender patients
attributes.background: In July 2013 I saw a doctor to get a referral to gender clinic about my gender dysphoria because I was struggling with feeling uncomfortable being in the wrong gender in the society the doctor said the referral will be sent off in 2 weeks but 2 months later  my sociologist tried to chase it up
attributes.additional_details: but found out that  their forgot to do the paper work 1 year half later I chased up my appointment for my 2nd opinion for top surgery in Daventry hospital in February I received a letter from my GIC to confirm that the referral been submitted in April I called up Daventry the person from the reception said that haven't received a referral from GIC I was annoyed. I want to make them realise that we as transgender people deserve the best care we need in order to live a better life

attributes.action: Put a lesson on Inter-sectional Feminism in the British PSHE curriculum.
attributes.background: Include a mandatory lesson on the importance of practicing an inter-national feminism in the PSHE curriculum for secondary school pupils.
attributes.additional_details: It is devastating how many teenagers not only do not understand the meaning of feminism, but also how many promote a feminism which exclusively supports the empowerment of white, straight, cis-gender, able-bodied and financially-stable women. Teaching secondary school children about the importance of inter-sectional feminism would help to raise a generation which believes in equality for women of all race, sexuality and class.

attributes.action: Abolish plans for the Teaching Excellence Framework in Higher Education
attributes.background: The TEF will mean that teachers are subject to a disciplinary panel which monitors their performance in accordance with 'government standards'.  This bares negative consequences for students who will be taught to a test and reduces academics to the role of 'content providers'.
attributes.additional_details: Current proposals to introduce the TEF are manifested within the government's plans to marketise higher education. As tuition fees rise, research funding declines for academics who are monitored in accordance with the TEF and forced to compete for funding in order to stay secure in their jobs. The consequences are that the values of higher education will change and teaching quality will decline as higher education will resemble the secondary education system.

attributes.action: Spread awareness about Mental Health. It's a bigger killer than cancer.
attributes.background: 1in4 people in the UK suffer from Mental Health. There's a stigma attached which needs to be banished so people can easily and proudly seek the help needed. Campaigns need to be set up such as tv/radio adverts like you see/hear daily about other illnesses as this ones the biggest killer.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information on facts/figures, where to seek help and advice follow the link below to my post. 
Together we need to beat the stigma and make the UK realise this is something that should be talked about daily. In schools, in the workplace etc. Due to the stigma people are not getting the help needed and funds are being cut to do with mental health. 
It is not anything to be ashamed of, its an illness.
http://turquoisetrouble.blogspot.co.uk/2016/05/mental-health-awareness-listen-love.html

attributes.action: Allow all Policers who have served 20 years to be awarded the LSGC Medal.
attributes.background: From 1951 all Police Officers had to serve 22 years in order to receive the Police LSGC Medal. However, on 19 January 2010, it was decided that Police Officers would only have to serve 20 years Police Service, bringing them in line with Fire, Ambulance and Prison LSGC Medals,
attributes.additional_details:
I am of the opinion that this is far from being fair to former Police Officers who gave excellent service to the public and who, for one reason or another, only completed 20 years Police Service. How on earth could any fair minded person come up with a plan so unfair and discriminatory. 
The change to the required service from 22 years to 20 years, made by Royal Warrant from19 January 2010, is therefore for officers in service on or after that date.
 It would appear that this is nothing more than a money saving exercise.

attributes.action: Ban gender-specific uniform policies
attributes.background:
Equality movements started being effective in the 1960's, yet we haven't seen modern equality spread to school uniform policy. 
Nobody should be expected to dress a certain way purely because of the way they were born. 
This would also help fight abuse towards transgender schoolchildren.

attributes.action: Comprehensive Response to #PanamaPapers Leaks. CLOSE TAX AVOIDANCE LOOPHOLES
attributes.background:
In light of the recent Panama Papers leaks, we demand the government takes urgent steps to:

1. Shut down ALL tax avoidance loopholes in the UK.
2. Expand HMRC team which investigates tax evasion.
3. Call urgent meeting of G20 countries to thoroughly investigate shadow banking systems.
attributes.additional_details: The 11 million documents leaked from Mossack Fonseca, Panama, highlight a deep-rooted and corrupt system of global tax-avoidance schemes & shadow banking networks. Proportionally, the richest people in the world are paying less tax than middle and lower-income earners and that is totally unacceptable. Every year, Treasuries across the world are missing billions of pounds in revenue because of these tax-avoidance schemes. It's time to shut down the loopholes & invest the money in public services.

attributes.action: Fully regulate Student Loans Company, with reform of the repayment process.
attributes.background: Many graduates have been left thousands of pounds short by an administrative process that is not fit for purpose. This petition calls on the Government to reform the repayment process and regulate Student Loans Company in line with retail lenders.
attributes.additional_details:
Graduates leave education with thousands of pounds worth of debt that is repaid via their payslips. The money is collected by HMRC and passed to Student Loans Company annually to be credited to the outstanding balance.

Current arrangements mean that money is frequently not credited to the loan, despite being paid by the graduate. This means it can take longer to repay a student loan, while interest is accrued.

HMRC and SLC do not to have mechanisms to check/rectify mistakes in a timely manner.

attributes.action: We want a national strategy for excellent play opportunites in primary schools
attributes.background: A recent OFSTED report for Kender Primary school in London acknowledged the contribution of outstanding play opportunities in meeting all of the most important current areas of concern in child development, health and well-being.  Every school child has the right to play opportunites of this quality
attributes.additional_details:
A recent All Party Parliamentary Group report said that 
play is disappearing from childhood and anxiety, stress and inactivity in childhood are becoming an overwhelming problem. 
http://tinyurl.com/gqzar3v
 
In 7 years of primary school, children spend 1.4 years at play and yet there is no strategic approach on the value of play for every child, no support on play based staffing, no understanding of the value of free play and no funding to help improve the quality of play in schools.

attributes.action: Make Rail companies compensate for delays over 15 minutes
attributes.background: We are all frustrated by train delays whether its 5 mins, 10 mins or an hour plus. We must be compensated for even minor delays.
attributes.additional_details: Imagine you being late for a 9 AM meeting by 15 minutes and entering the meeting room with guilt or missing you flight by 15 minutes or Arriving late for your interview by 15 minutes. 15 minutes is a long time for spoiling your day. Lets the rich rail companies pay at least 50% for any delay between 15 to 30 minutes and 100% for delays more than 30 minutes.

attributes.action: We Demand A Full And Independent Inquiry Into Southeastern Rail's Poor Service
attributes.background: Southeastern Rail provide a terrible service. Every day, trains are significantly delayed or cancelled. The excuses they give are often laughable. As customers, we demand a full and independent inquiry into why this franchise is failing to deliver while fare prices continue to rise.

attributes.action: Stop teaching religious education in schools
attributes.background: Religion is about beliefs that should not be forced upon children and to allow children to make up their own minds when they become adults.

attributes.action: Reconsideration of Eric Pickles' decision in 2014 to approve a SRFI in St Albans
attributes.background: In light of Greg Clark's decision in July 2016 dismissing an appeal to build a International Freight Exchange on green belt in Colnbrook, we ask the new SOS for Communities and Local Government to use Greg Clark's criteria to overturn approval for a Strategic Rail Freight Interchange in St Albans.
attributes.additional_details: After the SOS twice refused planning permission for a SRFI development on 300 acres of green belt in St Albans, Hertfordshire, Eric Pickles changed his mind and approved it in July 2014 without allowing a conjoined enquiry with Colnbrook. Greg Clark in turning down the Colnbrook development concluded "that the benefits of the scheme do not clearly overcome the harm. Consequently very special circumstances do not exist to justify the development."(on green belt)

attributes.action: Make RAF Mildenhall a Theme Park/Water Park or Shopping Centre.
attributes.background: RAF Mildenhall is shutting shop in 2022 so let's turn it into something useful for the community. Not an Airport not more houses something for the local community and economy

attributes.action: Free blood tests for people putting themselves forward as Living Donors.
attributes.background:
If someone is willing to be a Living Donor, undergo invasive surgery to change peoples lives, and at the same time save the NHS money - surely, we can provide them a blood group certificate on the NHS and not ask them to pay for it? 
It's a selfless act, & being forced to go private is prohibitive.
attributes.additional_details:
I've lived with CKD for ten years, and now I am in need of a transplant or face years of dialysis. I am so lucky that a group of people have come forward as potential Living Donors.

These people are willing to undergo invasive surgery to change lives. This surgery would also save the NHS millions, transplanting kidneys is more cost efficient than dialysis. 

It's the principle - if someone is willing to undertake such a selfless act, as a society let's not ask them to pay for the privilege.

attributes.action: Merge mental health with medical. 1 secure ward in every hospital.
attributes.background: Why is there not 1 secured ward which can be used where staff are trained to deal with mental illnesses in a hospital? Why are M/H patients not treated with the same respect as those without? Do they not deserve the same respect and compassion as someone who has not got M/H issues?
attributes.additional_details: Nearly 3 months ago my sister started to develop a symptoms that needed checking she and her staff were told it would get better. She was finally admitted into hospital and needed urgent treatment to save her life. When we arrived I advised staff how quickly things could escalate. I had to ring her M/H team to tell the doctors how to sedate her. She was discharged after having a cardiac arrest the morning prior and we still don't know what happened. Many things went wrong prior to her stay and whilst in that shouldn't be happening. I can only see that the reason she was discharged was because the hospital could not mange her mental illness. One secured ward in a hospital with trained staff would change this and allow mental health patients to receive the medical treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: Reissue education white paper as a green paper.
attributes.background: The government has failed to consult the public on its plans for education. It should reissue the white  paper as green paper.

attributes.action: Create and publish a national database of public access defibrillators
attributes.background: It has been proven that someone who has a sudden cardiac arrest is much more likely to survive if they receive early defibrillation than CPR alone. A national database of publicly accessible AEDs would allow bystanders to quickly locate the nearest one and improve the patient's chances of survival.
attributes.additional_details:
Results of a study examining 1530 incidents of resuscitation attempts following sudden cardiac arrest ("Resuscitation", Vol 78:3 (Sep 2008), p. 275-280):
- where a public access defibrillator was used, in 26% of these cases the patient recovered well enough to eventually be discharged from hospital.
- where defibrillation did not occur until the arrival of medical personnel, in less than 3% of these cases did the patient recover well enough to eventually be discharged from hospital.

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: Single-use plastic bottles are not designed to be re-used. Thus, many people buy and later throw these bottles away. These bottles, like much litter, ends up on streets and is blown by the wind, into rivers, polluting them.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic harms the environment and our health. Animals often die from being suffocated and poisoned by it. Some marine organisms, like fish, can be eaten by humans, spreading the plastic further into the food chain.

Banning these bottles leaves people with suitable alternatives. Re-usable plastic bottles are not the most eco-friendly alternative, but is still a better option as they can be re-used several times. Metal bottles can be used as they are made to last for a much longer time.

attributes.action: All visitors to UK  to require visas before gaining entry, as in the USA
attributes.background: To stop the wrong type of person getting into UK and to stop terrorists getting in.
attributes.additional_details: America has used Visa system for years, it seems to work.  As we share Intel with the States it would be useful here.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to discrimination against families when renting property.
attributes.background: Tennants with children are finding it increasingly difficult to rent a suitable, 2 bedroom property. Landlords and agents are using the unfair excuse that children cause extra wear on the property, yet a deposit is still taken to cover damages. It is leaving young families in difficult situations
attributes.additional_details:
My partner and I are currently facing homelessness after being served a section 21 on our flat. The landlord has decided to renovate the property, but will not allow children in it once it is finished. 
While searching for a new place for us to live, we are consistently met with the "No pets, No Children" statement.Like our daughter is as low as a dog! We live in an expensive area and are struggling to find suitable properties that allow children. 
I have contacted numerous agents and no differ.

attributes.action: Sanctions on the Palestinian Authority affecting all funds going from the UK
attributes.background: In response to the non uk broadcast death of a 13 year old girl in her bedroom in Israel, her throat being slit whilst she slept, by a Palestinian terrorist. This is not the first time and sadly it certainly will not be the last.
attributes.additional_details:
See Israeli news and foreign media reports. Speak to the conservative and labour friends of Israel groups.
In response to the non uk broadcast death of a 13 year old girl in her bedroom in Israel, her throat being slit whilst she slept, by a Palestinian terrorist, sanctions to be placed against the Palestinian authority affecting all funds going from the UK to them, as well as to Hamas, until they put an end to calls for citizens to use knives in attacks on Israeli men, women and children.

attributes.action: Abolish the banned dog breed list
attributes.background: The banned dog breed list is inhumane against the dogs on it. The police can seize a dog if they think it is a Pitbull. So any cross Staffie could be classed as a pitbull in the police's eyes. No dog is aggressive unless the owner makes them. The owners are to blame not the dog.
attributes.additional_details:
Banned dogs
In the UK, it’s against the law to own certain types of dog. These are the:

Pit Bull Terrier
Japanese Tosa
Dogo Argentino
Fila Braziliero

If your dog matches many of the characteristics of a Pit Bull Terrier, it may be a banned type.
A police or council dog expert will judge what type of dog you have and it will be kept in kennels while the police (or council) apply to a court
You’re not allowed to visit your dog while you wait for the court decision.

attributes.action: Establish a constitutional convention
attributes.background: The UK has no written constitution. We also have a highly undemocratic voting system which consistently results in one party getting majority control with a minority of votes. We need a constitutional convention to address this and other issues like the House of Lords and leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Local and parliamentary elections are undemocratic as voters do not get the result they voted for overall, due to the first past the post voting system. The House of Lords is entirely appointed. We have incomplete devolution and our legislature is not set up to deal with this satisfactorily. We need a constitutional convention to address these issues and draft a written constitution. With our exit from the EU having so much impact, this is the perfect time for this initiative.

attributes.action: Ensure 100% broadband coverage for everyone in the UK.
attributes.background: Access to broadband is now a key utility, & in business relied upon as much as water, light and heat. 95% of the UK is covered by some form of broadband connection is fine; denying the remaining 5% - businesses and consumers - (mainly rural areas) is a disgrace; & is creating a two speed country.
attributes.additional_details: Approx. a million businesses & homes — mainly rural areas — will not be receiving superfast broadband by close of 2016, and for those who have poor broadband service, its ‘Universal Service Obligation’ will require homes and businesses in the 5 per cent of areas that don’t yet have fast broadband to request the service & pay for it themselves. It could take until 2020 for the connection to arrive. This petition is to fix this unjust & ensure the Government reverts to their promise 100% service.

attributes.action: Stop the use of the Professional Skills tests (Qualified Teacher Status QTS)
attributes.background: My daughter has ADHD. She's been offered a degree with QTS but failed the tests twice. The format causes sensory issues for her. Why is she not competent when she passed her GCSEs with an AB&C in 2014? Why are we allowing discriminating tests to lose passionate teachers of our future generations?
attributes.additional_details:
All prospective trainee teachers must pass the skills tests before they can be recommended for the award of qualified teacher status (QTS). It consists of two exams, some questions are written and presented in a series of on-screen questions, others are audio with headphones. 
Surely we should be ensuring we train the right people and not place a barrier in their way that appears to be meaningless and provides no evidence to support it has any impact on the selection process?

attributes.action: Require a minimum turnout of 70% and a  majority of 10% in the EU referendum
attributes.background:
This would ensure that a minimum of 40% of the UK electorate is in favour of leaving the European Union before any change can happen.
It is the most significant decision that the British public is likely to make this decade;  it must demonstrate wide public support
attributes.additional_details: The UK government has tried to ensure that constitutional changes in former Commonwealth countries have only happened after demonstrating majority support by a minimum turnout in an election or referendum and a significant majority in favour of the change.  We should apply the same standards to ourselves.

attributes.action:
- Provide better funding for mental health care 

- Raise awareness in schools
attributes.background:
The government cut mental health funding recently by 8%, 1 in 4 people in the UK will suffer from a mental health problem (including children) and will require help and treatment.

It is vital that materials are available in schools, so that children are well informed about mental illness.
attributes.additional_details:
In England mental health is clearly a growing problem as:

- 1 in 4 will suffer from a mental health illness at any given year.
- Nearly 3 in 4 young people fear the reactions of their friends when they talk about their mental health problems with them.
- 90% of people who die through suicide in the UK are experiencing mental distress.
- 17 in 100 people have suicidal thoughts.
- About 4% of children between the age of 5-16 suffer anxiety or depression.
- 9 out of 10 will suffer stigma.

attributes.action: Creation of a national Music Day: free music in everyone's local area.
attributes.background: Music Day is an international celebration that has existed in other European countries since 1982, where it has always taken place on 21st  June.
attributes.additional_details:
On this day there are free performances in both public spaces and established venues it ensures that arts and music are accessible to everyone for at least one day of the year.
 
We would like to see Music Day made official and for it made easier for people to hold concerts in public spaces on this date, to encourage the participation of all musicians and event organisers.

attributes.action: The UK must ban the foreign financing of all new MOSQUES
attributes.background: As we go forward in the Uk,it has become apparent that the Uk like other European countries has a problem with the financing of mosques.We call on the government to ban all foreign finance from building or the planning of any new mosques

attributes.action: I want the Meningitis B vaccination to be free for everyone in the UK
attributes.background: Recently whilst on holiday in Barcelona I fell ill with bacterial meningitis. As a child I was not offered the vaccination which could have potentionally prevented me from getting this horrific and life threatening disease. Instead of having a three day holiday I was in hospital for two weeks.
attributes.additional_details: I want this strain of meningitis to be prevented by the vaccination being available to everyone that may need it.  I understand babies are now being given the vaccination. But all others that are not vaccinated are still at risk and deserve to be prevented for free!!!

attributes.action: Ensure that all PIP assessment centres are accessible by those who cannot walk
attributes.background: Too many PIP assessment centres are not accessible to people with walking difficulties, in that the nearest car park is too far away, or the assessment rooms are not on the ground floor. The government needs to ensure all assessment centres have accessible parking and disabled lifts.

attributes.action: UK Government to stop using the term 'Islamic State' & refer to them as 'Daesh'.
attributes.background: In the wake of many terrorist attacks around the world, the British Government must not associate the religious beliefs of 3 million UK Muslims with that of a terrorist organisation. Doing so aids hate crimes and the social campaigns of the terrorists. The name "Daesh" should be used in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: I am a Muslim living in the UK. When I hear the term "Islamic State", "ISIL" or "so-called Islamic State", I wonder why we are assisting the terrorists in their hate campaigns. I find it an insult to hear the term used, as would the 400,000 Muslims that served this land in World War 1 or currently serving in the army. These terrorists are referred to as "Daesh" in predominantly Muslim countries. The term "Islamic State" is a perversion of a religion, consisting of 23% of the global population.

attributes.action: Open negotiations to join the Schengen Area.
attributes.background: Switzerland, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein are in Schengen without being in the EU. Schengen allows for free movement and common visa policy across Europe, without requiring welfare support for immigrants, and provides for police and judicial cooperation to fight transnational crime.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has voted to leave the European Union but many people, especially young people in Britain, value being able to travel and work freely across Europe. We value the contribution that visitors and residents from elsewhere in Europe make to our economy and society. We will likely be required to agree to freedom of movement as part of any deal to join the European Economic Area or EFTA. We could start negotiating to join Schengen before triggering formal negotiations to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Produce a clear and costed plan on Brexit before triggering Article 50
attributes.background: Whichever way we voted - leave or remain - we the undersigned, demand that Article 50 is not triggered until there is a clear and costed plan. The U.K's citizens have a right to understand the true implications of leaving the EU before it is legally set in stone.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Article 50?

Article 50 is the technical part of the EU treaty that triggers the withdrawal process from the European Union. 

It's the point of no return.

attributes.action: Ban takeaways from using Non-Recyclable Polystyrene boxes & packaging for food.
attributes.background: In recent years there has been a concentrated focus on recycling. We are encouraged to recycle wherever possible, yet most takeaways/restaurants have shifted from using recyclable packaging (paper/card) to non recyclable polystyrene. Petition is to make them use recyclable packaging only.

attributes.action: Change National Planning Policy which permits inappropriate housing development
attributes.background: The current government planning policy means that if councils don't have a 5 year land supply for housing developers can cast aside planning policy and build on our beautiful countryside.  Local opinion and landscape designation are ignored resulting in development on greenfield sites.
attributes.additional_details: Across the country our neighbourhoods are under threat by developers who speculatively submit planning applications knowing that our councils don't have the finances or resources to challenge them.  There is clearly a need for more housing however a huge amount of brownfield available with planning permission which developers are land banking whilst they exploit the weakness in our planning policy that enables them to force through development on cheaper to develop greenfield sites.

attributes.action: Prevent  Political Parties  from fielding candidates for PCC vacancies.
attributes.background:
The role of the Police in the UK has traditionaly been non-political.  The practice of allowing Political Parties to field and support candidates for the roll of Police and Crime Commissioner is wrong.
Politics needs to be kept out of Policing and PCCs should have no political affiliation.

attributes.action: Change In Dog Walking Legislation - In Public Places Within The UK
attributes.background:
I am calling for a change in the law to make it compulsory all dog owners in the UK have sufficient control over their dog by making it mandatory dogs are walked on a lead in public places at all times.
I believe action is required due to the number of dog attacks particularly on young children.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs which are not under the direct control of their owners can be unpredictable and cause anxiety to people of all ages, all dogs are potentially dangerous. 
My own child was attacked by a dog at the age of 3 and is left permanently scarred, I have friends who have experienced their child being attacked and I feel strongly that the law needs changed.

attributes.action: Vehicles powered by fossil fuels should be banned from UK cities by 2025
attributes.background: Air pollution is linked to 40,000 early deaths per year in the UK. A major contributor to the state of air quality is the use of vehicles powered by fossil fuels on Britain's roads. Climate change and health implications aside, just imagine the air in our cities being as fresh as an alpine breeze.
attributes.additional_details: Clean air technology exists in the form of electric engines, batteries, and hydrogen fuel cells. Cars and other vehicles powered by this technology are currently expensive, and out of the reach of most consumers and business. However, legislation could increase the pace of innovation within automotive industries in order to make such technology cheap and available to all. This will be a big step towards the cleaner brighter future that we all deserve.

attributes.action: Ban artificial colours (E numbers) from children's medicine in the UK
attributes.background: Many medicines for children and babies still contain dangerous E numbers. E.g Calpol has E122; a colour which can cause health issues, behavioural problems and hyperactivity in children. The FSA advises against giving such colourings to children. Natural colours should be used instead if required.
attributes.additional_details:
Much information is available, but here are just a few of the links:
http://www.nhs.uk/news/2013/10October/Pages/Call-to-ban-additives-in-childrens-medicines.aspx
http://www.webmd.boots.com/add-adhd/guide/food-dye-adhd
http://www.feingold.org/Research/PDFstudies/E-numbers.pdf
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/children/10395491/Additives-in-Calpol-should-be-banned-due-to-hyperactivity-in-children.html
http://www.food.gov.uk/sites/default/files/multimedia/pdfs/labellingcoloursreg13332008.pdf

attributes.action: Make driving a Motorcycle with no protective clothing / leathers illegal.
attributes.background: My Dad was involved in a serious bike accident, which bought home to our family the seriousness and how dangerous it can really be. I am tired of seeing people riding motorcycles with just a helmet, I cannot watch another family go through what we have.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory Sexual Education lessons in Secondary Schools in the UK
attributes.background: In the early hours of the 12th June 2016, a horrific, homophobic-fuelled attack happened in a gay club in Orlando. In response to this tragedy, I am proposing that we bring back compulsory Sexual Education Lessons, with a focus on LGBTQIA+ and Feminism in order to help eradicate homophobia.
attributes.additional_details: As a 15 year old, I can tell you levels of homophobia in Secondary Schools are high, and actual Sexual Education lessons are no longer compulsory. The school has to do something, but actual lessons are no longer compulsory. I believe that homophobia in secondary schools is a direct result of this. I am LGBTQ+, and I always see this prejudice and discrimination in school and on social media and it is sickening. Now more than ever, the UK needs to be united, and attempt to eradicate homophobia.

attributes.action: Free childcare when both parents are working. Not just those who are on benefits
attributes.background: Free childcare is in place for 2 year olds where the parents have low income and mostly on benefits and don't work. If the parents are not working then their children don't need childcare. My husband and I work very hard to provide for our family but have to pay huge amount of money for childcare.
attributes.additional_details: When childcare is paid for when both parents are working it makes a huge dent in income, we could do with the help. All children deserve this, It seems as though I would be better off not working.

attributes.action: The UK must renegotiate deal with EU regarding the cruel trade and import of fur
attributes.background: As the fur industry grows - worth $40 billion worldwide - the cruelty it funds is becoming clear, and a UK ban gains support. The 'in/out' referendum approaches for the UK, and upon the option of staying in the EU, the proposal to ban the trade and import of fur in the UK should be considered.
attributes.additional_details:
On fur factory farms, animals are crammed into tiny cages, deprived of space, proper hygiene, and often skinned alive. Years ago, red paint was thrown on wearers of fur in protest. No penalties exist for some of the largest fur exporters on the planet - this industry should never have become acceptable. 
Previous petitions for banning fur were rejected as the UK has no control over this issue. A condition for its stay in the EU should be a ban on the import and sale of fur in the UK is debated.

attributes.action: Stop hospitals putting DNAR orders onto patients records against their will .
attributes.background: My father was admitted to the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Birmingham on Monday with heart failure and fluid overload. My father has a living will that he wants life to be maintained. The hospital has put a DNAR onto my father's records, my father has objected but the objection has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
The hospital will not remove the DNAR.  Are the patient’s wishes no longer of paramount importance? You have to ask what's the point of a living will? The consultant says the decision is due to Dad’s age & the fact he has heart failure which will only get worse.    
How many people are going into hospital & have DNAR put on their records against their wishes? This practice must be stopped, people's wishes are not being respected.  It's like euthanasia in disguise.

attributes.action: cap the profit individuals are allowed to make on ticket resale websites.
attributes.background: There is no cap on the profit individuals are allowed to make when reselling tickets using the appropriate resale websites. This is means people are able to make an extreme profit on the hard work of artists. Exploitation of the arts industry like this should not be acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Ticket resale websites such as getmein.com and viagogo.co.uk allow individuals to resell tickets for events at extortionate prices. For example the recent sell out of Catfish and the Bottlemen's tour has lead to hundred's of tickets being available for up to ten times face value of the ticket just minutes after the event sold out. Although the live music industry is where this problem is most significant, individuals continue to capitalise on events throughout the arts performance industry.

attributes.action: Update Psychiatric Diagnosis Procedures so they are accountable & evidence-based
attributes.background: Psychiatry is under criticism for its subjectivity and unaccountability.Brief crises are defined as lifelong conditions.There is no recognition of this ambiguity.Complaints are seen as symptoms.Patients are misunderstood or slandered.The pessimism of working in a Hospital causes Confirmation Bias.

attributes.action: Fund Home Schooling For SEN Children that cannot access mainstream schools
attributes.background: My two children have autism spectrum disorder and also suffer with anxiety. They find going into the school impossible. Since taking them out of school they are doing fantastic. But this as caused us to reduce our working hours and causes us financial problems. All we need is a little help
attributes.additional_details: If like with in elderly care a percentsge of the money set aside for a childs education could be paid to parents to home educate a child with special educational needs. It would enable child to recieve a good quality home education and relieve the financial burdon on the family.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as P.M
attributes.background: Theresa May has had a one house race to become prime minister without anyone voting for her outside of parliament. Therefor a General Election should be called within 1 year.
